question_text: Which of the following practices are critical when terminating cables at a punchdown block? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Minimize pair untwist to preserve signal integrity
Route cables tightly to reduce slack
Follow the correct wiring standard consistently
Bend cables at 90Â° angles for compactness
correct_answer: Minimize pair untwist to preserve signal integrity
Follow the correct wiring standard consistently
explanation: Best practices include preserving pair twist near the termination point, labeling cables for management, and consistently following standards like TIA/EIA-568A/B. Sharp bends should be avoided.
